title: Another Autofill rant...
body:
Ok so like many of you out there im in low elo i'm not amazing at the game and want to get better. Currently im silver 2 and hoping to get s1 or gold by the season start but autofill is decreasing the amount of games im playing. here's why:

NOBODY WANTS SUPPORT: this is the main issue and why autofill was introduced in the first place but the problem is the dodge penalties are too small so when anyone gets autofilled to support and no one is willing to swap they dodge (including myself as i don't like playing support and i cant play it well well at all) -3 lp is better than losing 17 lp if you see yourself losing because you are the support 

MULTIPLE CHAMPION SELECTS: ok here is one that really annoys me i queue up with mid and top  (i can jg if needed) and get a champion select 9/10 times i get top (Primary roles should be weighted more but thats a rant for another time) but the person who got support also picked mid and top and usually they will say something like "anyone want to swap?" or "mid or top want to swap" which is absolutely fine but when they get the same answer 9/10 times "No" they dodge then i get another champion select and everyone is happy with their roles except no someone on the other team dodges this happens again and again until I get autofilled to support and guess what i do the same thing (refer to previous point) putting me on a 5 min wait and - 3 lp and this entire process will take about 15 - 20 mins

my point is autofill was brought into the game to lower queue times but it doesn't as it indirectly makes queue times longer because of everyone dodging and i dont blame them for dodging many people find support very boring or some people just are not good at it so they will take -3 lp and a 5 min wait over support anyday.

Being able to veto a role from autofill may help but we all know the one role everyone would veto would be support giving us longer queue times due to a lack of support players putting us back at square 1   

Rant over Thanks for reading 

I would really like to know what this is like at higher elos if someone is willing to comment Thanks! :)

Great post! 

Auto-fill is affecting everyone negatively right now. Even as support main I've been experiencing longer queues because enemies keep dodging :(

At this point Riot has has tried almost all the obvious solutions. The "veto a role" idea was [tested on PBE](http://www.surrenderat20.net/2016/09/929-pbe-update.html#position) for a bit, but it's since been removed which is probably an indicator that it didn't work.

Here's where I think we need to start pushing Riot to look to next:

+ **Hire An Economist**

 A lack of supports is actually a _'lack of a positive production externality'_. And it's causing a loss in net welfare/social efficiency (which you feel as long queue times and being forced to play support). This problem is 100% economics 101.

 I'm absolutely confident that someone with a strong understanding for incentive structures and market failures can fix this issue for good. Give him free rein of PBE for a few weeks and we'll have a solution in no time :D


+ **Support Rework**

  I'm more hesitant on this one. Every support main will tell you that support is the most balanced role in the game, so a big rework is worrying.

 But if Riot pulls off what they [have planned](http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/champions-skins/free-rotation/some-thoughts-support), it could go really well for the role. 

 The biggest thing being **recognition**, we need something like [Overwatch end game cards](http://i.imgur.com/7f9hUIN.jpg), and achievements for support.

The actual solution is likely going to be a combination of the two. But it's definitely time to take some bolder action on this IMO.

Hi im glad you agree 

maybe making the dodge penalties harsher could help? but i'm not sure.

It would help queue times, but you'd strongly disincentivize legitimate dodges. Which means people are more likely to not dodge the "troll Soraka jungle" game, because the penalty of doing so is too high. This would make the game very unenjoyable in these situations.

What auto-fill should actually do is; If you were given support and dodge, it will give you support next time no matter what. Even if you re-queue in an hour.

That way there's no benefit in dodging for a new role, since you'll just end up going support again. This is a good short term solution, but in the long run we really need some of the things I outlined above.

>I would really like to know what this is like at higher elos if someone is willing to comment Thanks! :)

It depends. 

Many players in Diamond and above are comfortable playing multiple roles which means there's a chance you'll never find out whether or not someone was autofilled. Sometimes you _immediately_ find out someone is a one trick or playing on a smurf account set up for only one role, which can cause frustration if a swap can't be agreed upon. I've even seen players rather arrogantly pick the champion they insist on playing but respect the role they've been autofilled (and win anyway). 

Dodging over autofill can occur but I'd say that dodging because of a bad team composition or champion pick is far more likely. As for queue times, it really depends on the time of the day and how many support mains are online. As a support main myself, that means I've never really experienced unbearably long queue times when I've been online ; )
